## RenderContext interface

The render context contains information needed when rendering a mod, either in the UI or as part of an export. TODO: Write/review documentation

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface RenderContext 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [imagePixelRatio](./spotfire-api.rendercontext.imagepixelratio.md) | <code>number</code> | The image pixel ratio is needed when the mod is rendering a rasterized image/canvas. |
|  [interactive](./spotfire-api.rendercontext.interactive.md) | <code>boolean</code> | A mod is not interactive when it is exported. This property can e.g. be used to hide controls in an export context. |
|  [styling](./spotfire-api.rendercontext.styling.md) | <code>StylingInfo</code> | Contains information about the currently used theme |

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [signalRenderComplete()](./spotfire-api.rendercontext.signalrendercomplete.md) | Signal that the mod is ready to be exported. If this method is not called, Spotfire will render your export/preview without knowing if it is done. The default maximum allowed time for a mod to finish rendering is 20 seconds. |
